segment.source: Deployment Troubleshooting
segment.target: Deployment Troubleshooting

segment.source: Deployment Troubleshooting
segment.target: Deployment Troubleshooting

segment.source: This topic includes information to help you troubleshoot deployment issues in Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0.
segment.target: This topic includes information to help you troubleshoot deployment issues in Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0.

segment.source: Troubleshooting Issues in MED-V Deployment
segment.target: Troubleshooting Issues in MED-V Deployment

segment.source: The following issue might occur when you deploy MED-V.
segment.target: The following issue might occur when you deploy MED-V.

segment.source: The solution helps troubleshoot this issue.
segment.target: The solution helps troubleshoot this issue.

segment.source: Problems Occur if Installing MED-V for Current User Only.
segment.target: Problems Occur if Installing MED-V for Current User Only.

segment.source: MED-V only supports the installation of the MED-V Workspace Packager, the MED-V Host Agent, and the MED-V workspace for all users.
segment.target: MED-V only supports the installation of the MED-V Workspace Packager, the MED-V Host Agent, and the MED-V workspace for all users.

segment.source: Installing for the current user only causes failures in the installation of the components and in the setup of the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Installing for the current user only causes failures in the installation of the components and in the setup of the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Never use the option ALLUSERS=”” when installing the MED-V components.
segment.target: Never use the option ALLUSERS=”” when installing the MED-V components.

segment.source: MED-V Requires Exclusive Use of the Virtualization Stack.
segment.target: MED-V Requires Exclusive Use of the Virtualization Stack.

segment.source: Only one virtualization stack can be run at a time on a computer.
segment.target: Only one virtualization stack can be run at a time on a computer.

segment.source: Windows Virtual PC must use the virtual stack, and MED-V depends on Windows Virtual PC.
segment.target: Windows Virtual PC must use the virtual stack, and MED-V depends on Windows Virtual PC.

segment.source: Therefore, if you try to deploy or use MED-V when other applications are running that use the virtual stack, MED-V cannot run or be successfully installed.
segment.target: Therefore, if you try to deploy or use MED-V when other applications are running that use the virtual stack, MED-V cannot run or be successfully installed.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Close any application that is running that uses the virtualization stack before you install or run MED-V.
segment.target: Close any application that is running that uses the virtualization stack before you install or run MED-V.

segment.source: Shortcuts Remain after Uninstall.
segment.target: Shortcuts Remain after Uninstall.

segment.source: By default, when you uninstall MED-V, shortcuts in the end user’s Start menu are removed.
segment.target: By default, when you uninstall MED-V, shortcuts in the end user’s Start menu are removed.

segment.source: However, in certain situations, such as for end users who are running roaming profiles, shortcuts to MED-V published applications remain in the end user’s Start menu.
segment.target: However, in certain situations, such as for end users who are running roaming profiles, shortcuts to MED-V published applications remain in the end user’s Start menu.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: To manually delete the remaining shortcuts on the Start menu, right-click the shortcuts, and then click Remove.
segment.target: To manually delete the remaining shortcuts on the Start menu, right-click the shortcuts, and then click Remove.

segment.source: Disable Logon Message Group Policy Setting in the MED-V Workspace.
segment.target: Disable Logon Message Group Policy Setting in the MED-V Workspace.

segment.source: If the Windows XP logon message is enabled in the MED-V workspace, the end user must log on every time they want to open a MED-V virtual application.
segment.target: If the Windows XP logon message is enabled in the MED-V workspace, the end user must log on every time they want to open a MED-V virtual application.

segment.source: This creates a poor user experience.
segment.target: This creates a poor user experience.

segment.source: Solution
segment.target: Solution

segment.source: Disable the following Group Policy settings in the MED-V virtual machine:
segment.target: Disable the following Group Policy settings in the MED-V virtual machine:

segment.source: Interactive logon: Message text for users attempting to log on
segment.target: Interactive logon: Message text for users attempting to log on

segment.source: Interactive logon: Message title for users attempting to log on
segment.target: Interactive logon: Message title for users attempting to log on
